title: Electric field midway between two charges

content.question: Small spheres <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> carry electrical charges <math alttext="q sub A equals 2.0 times 10 to the power negative 17 coulombs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>17</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="q sub B equals negative 2.0 times 10 to the power negative 17 coulombs" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>2.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>17</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, respectively. The spheres are separated by a distance of <math alttext="0.20 meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.20</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. The magnitude of the electric field at the midpoint between the charges is

choices.label: <math alttext="9.0 times 10 to the power negative 6 newtons per coulomb" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>9.0</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mstyle scriptlevel="+1"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="3.6 times 10 to the power negative 6 newtons per coulomb" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>3.6</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mstyle scriptlevel="+1"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="1.8 times 10 to the power negative 6 newtons per coulomb" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>1.8</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mstyle scriptlevel="+1"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="3.6 times 10 to the power negative 5 newtons per coulomb" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>3.6</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mstyle scriptlevel="+1"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="3.6 times 10 to the power negative 5 newtons per coulomb" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>3.6</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mstyle scriptlevel="+1"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
